title: NASA, Boeing pivot Starliner-1 mission from 4-person astronaut flight to cargo-only
summary: The change comes days after the mission’s previous commander was promoted to lead NASA’s Astronaut Office. NASA and Boeing are also reducing the required number of missions to the International Space Station from six down to four

title: NASA, Boeing Modify Starliner Contract: Fewer Launches, Cargo Only on Starliner-1
summary: NASA and Boeing have agreed to modify the contract for the Starliner commercial crew vehicle designed to ferry astronauts to and from the International Space Station. Repeated setbacks in Starliner’s […]

title: NASA’s 2025 Astronaut Candidates: Shaping Artemis Exploration
summary: When NASA’s 2025 astronaut candidates arrived at the agency’s Johnson Space Center in Houston this fall, they stepped into history, sharing a common mission to master the skills and teamwork that define NASA’s next era of exploration.  Selected from a pool of more than 8,000 applicants, the new class represents a range of backgrounds — […]

title: NASA to fly only cargo on next Starliner mission under modified contract
summary:
NASA has revised its commercial crew contract with Boeing, reducing the number of Starliner missions to four, the first of which will carry only cargo.
The post NASA to fly only cargo on next Starliner mission under modified contract appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: NASA confirms that Starliner’s next mission will be cargo only
summary: As space station's lifetime nears its end, NASA also cuts some future Starliner flights.

title: New NASA HEAT and My NASA Data Resources Bring Space Weather Science into Classrooms
summary: As the Sun enters a period of heightened activity, students now have a new way to explore its powerful effects on Earth and space. NASA’s Heliophysics Education Activation Team (NASA HEAT), in collaboration with My NASA Data, has released a new set of classroom resources that invite students and educators to engage with real NASA […]

title: NASA, NOAA Rank 2025 Ozone Hole as 5th Smallest Since 1992
summary: The ozone hole over the Antarctic was small in 2025 compared to previous years and remains on track to recover later this century. The hole this year was the fifth smallest since 1992, the year a landmark international agreement to phase out ozone-depleting chemicals began to take effect.

title: NASA Citizen Science Toolkit for Librarians
summary: NASA’s Toolkit for Librarians can help you share NASA citizen science opportunities with your patrons and community members. Rural and urban libraries, informal educators, youth group leaders, and retirement community coordinators can all benefit from this resource. Together, we can open the door for more people to join the fun, learning, and thrill of doing NASA science.

title: City Lights and Atmospheric Glow
summary: JAXA (Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency) astronaut Kimiya Yui captured this photo of southern Europe and the northwestern Mediterranean coast from the International Space Station as it orbited 261 miles above Earth on Aug. 30, 2025. At left, the Po Valley urban corridor in Italy shines with the metropolitan areas of Milan and Turin and their […]
